com.facebook.litho.reference

Class Reference<L>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.litho.reference.Reference<L>
  • Deprecated. 
    Just use the object directly instead.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class Reference<L>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a unique instance of a reference that is driven by its matching ReferenceLifecycle subclass. Use acquire(ComponentContext, Reference) to acquire the underlying resource and release(ComponentContext, Object, Reference) to release it when it's not needed anymore.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        public static <T> T acquire(ComponentContext context,
                            Reference<T> reference)
        Deprecated. 
        Acquires a Reference of type T. It is responsibility of the caller to release the acquired object by calling release(ComponentContext, Object, Reference). Calling acquire twice with the same reference does not guarantee that the same instance will be returned twice.

      • release

        public static <T> void release(ComponentContext context,
                               T value,
                               Reference<T> reference)
        Deprecated. 
        Releases the object previously acquired by calling acquire(ComponentContext, Reference). An object that was released calling this function should not be retained or used in any way.

      • getSimpleName

        public abstract java.lang.String getSimpleName()
        Deprecated. 

      • shouldUpdate

        public static <T> boolean shouldUpdate(Reference<T> previous,
                                       Reference<T> next)
        Deprecated. 
        Checks whether acquiring object from two references will produce the same result. This is implemented by default calling Object.equals(Object). When defining a custom reference it's possible to provide custom logic for the comparison implementing a method annotated with the ShouldUpdate annotation.
